## üìö References

**Format Specification:**
- Located at the end of the document (before metadata footer)
- Include only authoritative, public references relevant to the session topic
- For EVERY reference provide:
  * Full title and clickable URL
  * 2-3 sentence explanation of what the reference covers
  * Clear statement of why it's relevant to this analysis

**Example:**
```markdown
## üìö References

**[Azure Service Fabric Documentation](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/service-fabric/)**
This is the official Microsoft documentation for Azure Service Fabric, covering architecture, deployment patterns, and operational best practices. It's essential for understanding the foundational concepts discussed in this session and provides detailed implementation guidance for all patterns mentioned.

**[Microservices Architecture Patterns](https://microservices.io/patterns/microservices.html)**
Chris Richardson's comprehensive catalog of microservices patterns, including decomposition strategies, data management, and communication patterns. This resource provides broader context for the Service Fabric-specific implementations discussed and helps understand the architectural trade-offs.

**[Azure Service Fabric Samples GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Azure-Samples/service-fabric-dotnet-getting-started)**
Official Microsoft sample applications demonstrating Service Fabric features, including the demos referenced in this session. Provides hands-on code examples for implementing the patterns and practices discussed by the speakers.
```

[Your actual references here following the format above]
